intro: Barlia spitzelii, commonly known as the Spitzelii barlia, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a potential source of medicinal compounds and its ecological value in its native habitat.
